content: As a Male Puritan living in the Massachusetts Bay Colony in 1632, I would likely have a very different perspective on King Charles I. The Puritans were deeply suspicious of the English monarchy, and believed that the English Church was corrupt. They would have seen the King as a tyrant who interfered with their religious freedom and sought to impose his own will on the colonies. They would also believe that the King was impious and that he was not following the God's will. From my point of view, I would not think that King Charles I is an effective leader.
